greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Dragonette's sequence gamma(n).
comment: Gamma(n) is used to compute coefficients in series expansion of mock theta function f(q) via A[n]==Sum[P[r]gamma[n-r],{r,0,n}], with P the partition function A000041.
reference: G. E. Andrews, The theory of partitions, Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, 1998, page 82, Example 5. MR1634067 (99c:11126)
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000
L. A. Dragonette, Some Asymptotic Formulae for the Mock Theta Series of Ramanujan, Trans. Amer. Math. Soc., 72 (1952), 474-500. See page 496.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Mock Theta Function.
formula: Convolution of this sequence and A000041 is A000025. - _Michael Somos_, Jun 19 2003
mathematica: a[ n_]:= SeriesCoefficient[1 +4 *Sum[(-1)^k*x^(k*(3*k+1)/2)/(1+x^k), {k, Quotient[Sqrt[1 +24*n] - 1, 6]}], {x, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Apr 08 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, n==0, 4 * polcoeff( sum(k=1, (sqrtint(24*n + 1) - 1) \ 6, (-1)^k * x^((3*k^2 + k)/2) / (1 + x^k), x * O(x^n)), n))}; /* _Michael Somos_, Mar 13 2006 */
results.author: _Eric W. Weisstein_, Aug 28 2001
